title: The best gifts for Fortnite fans
description: Fortnite is the only video game where you can play as Snoop Dogg and land a headshot on Paul Atreides. While it started as a very different kind of game, it’s known nowadays as a popular battle royale shooter and multimedia melting pot. You can play as characters from franchises spanning gaming, movies, and anime. […]
author: Alice Jovanée
excerpt: Jump into the rich world of Fortnite with our selection of games, apparel, books, and more
text: Photo composition: Alice Jovanee/Polygon | Source images: Epic, Hasbro [superimposing product images onto an altered background]Fortnite is the only video game where you can play as Snoop Dogg and land a headshot on Paul Atreides. While it started as a very different kind of game, it’s known nowadays as a popular battle royale shooter and multimedia melting pot. You can play as characters from franchises spanning gaming, movies, and anime.In addition to its knack for collaborating with other brands, developer and publisher Epic Games is known for its experimentation with Fortnite (the third-person shooter recently added a tactical first-person mode). Whether you’re an avid fan who’s deep into the latest season, or prefer to stick with Fortnite’s OG mode, we’ve found 30 gifts you can buy for your favorite Fortnite fan.Polygon’s top picksBest Fortnite booksBest Fortnite toys and gunsBest Fortnite accessoriesBest Fortnite decorBest Fortnite game accessoriesBest Fortnite books$16Having trouble placing in the top 10? The official survival guide for Fortnite gives you the best tips and tricks, right from the game’s makers. (If that’s not enough, check out our beginner’s guide.)$11An officially licensed drawing book that teaches you how to draw Fortnite’s most iconic items and characters, including the Loot Llama, Battle Bus, and Cuddle Team Leader.$7Fortnite is a game that draws from a vast palette of vivid pastel colors. This unofficial coloring book contains over 60 pages of characters, gear, and locations for you to bring to life.$17Characters from Fortnite team up with some of your favorite Marvel superheroes like Wolverine, Spider-Man, and more. This hardcover compilation includes all five issues of Fortnite x Marvel: Zero War, and Fortnite x Marvel - Nexus War: Thor.Best Fortnite toys and guns$23Drop into this special edition of Monopoly, complete with game-specific pieces, cards, and more.$40This motorized assault rifle features a 10-dart clip and comes with a bonus code to unlock a similar in-game skin.$40The Nerf Fortnite Storm Scout is a camper’s best friend with its six-dart clip and detachable scope.$20This twin-pack of Nerf blasters includes a single-shot Peely blaster, and the SR Ripe hand cannon with a four-dart capacity and an optional scope.$40Fortnite’s unofficial mascot and loot box is now available as a 691-piece Lego model. This domesticated pack animal features a hollow interior that can be filled with Lego versions of gear from the game.$80This 10-pack of four-inch poseable figurines features an array of Fortnite characters, including Agent Peely, Mancake, Doctor Sloane, and more.Best Fortnite accessories$27This Fortnite-themed backpack comes in various colors and patterns to match your style.$27This baseball cap comes in multiple patterns, including one with Fortnite’s signature typeface across the brim.$10The official Fortnite Loot Pack comes with pins, patches, vinyl stickers, and magnets to decorate any surface from fridges to backpacks.$18A polyester wallet with Fortnite graphic art printed on it. Includes zipper closure and coin pocket.$49This plush neon-tinted oversized hoodie is the perfect way to stay toasty in your favorite camping spot.Best Fortnite decor$15Simple, Fortnite-themed posters based on the game’s most popular skins. $6Fortnite birthday cards to give to your friends and family, or perhaps to a battle royale fan in your life.$23A golden Christmas ornament based on Loot llama. It’s plastic, so it’s not heavy or difficult to clean.$85Fortnite doesn’t leave you, even in your dreams. A full twin bed set, including one reversible comforter, one fitted sheet, one flat sheet, one pillowcase, and one pillow sham.$35An acrylic bedside lamp featuring a spray paint styled logo of Fortnite’s de-facto mascot that can be powered via micro USB or by using three AAA batteries.$20This Fortnite Boogie Bomb lights up the room like a disco ball and plays music. Perfect for any child or adult who wants a unique party gadget.$15A 40 by 50-inch throw blanket with Loot Llama printed across its colorful, plush surface.Best Fortnite game accessories$136The latest version of Razer’s wireless Deathadder gaming mouse is equipped with a 30K DPI optical sensor and a lightweight design. This Fortnite-branded version also includes a code for the Cliffhanger pickaxe in-game item.$72The Fortnite-branded version of the wired Razer Kraken V3 X features a retractable boom mic, 7.1 spatial audio, and replaces the RGB Razer logo on the side with a llama. You’ll also get a code for the Raptor Glider to use in-game.$92Give your desk the Fortnite treatment with this Battle Bus-inspired mouse mat. This 36-inch long mat from Razer features customizable RGB lighting around the edges and comes with a code for the Dauntless Dragon Glider in-game item.$60Play Fortnite Festival without a massive guitar controller. This seemingly conventional controller has five side-mounted fret buttons to emulate the inputs necessary to rock out without the need for a plastic instrument.$8Starting from $8.99 for 1000 V-Bucks, this precious premium currency makes for an ideal stocking filler for any Fortnite fan. V-Bucks can also be redeemed regardless of what platform you’re playing on.$130Play Fortnite Festival the way the good lord intended, with a replica guitar controller. The Riffmaster features a layout that will be familiar to Rock Band veterans, including solo buttons and a whammy bar.ShopkeeperPolygon’s handpicked deals on games, movies, books, and more.
html:
Photo composition: Alice Jovanee/Polygon | Source images: Epic, Hasbro [superimposing product images onto an altered background]

Fortnite is the only video game where you can play as Snoop Dogg and land a headshot on Paul Atreides. While it started as a very different kind of game, it’s known nowadays as a popular battle royale shooter and multimedia melting pot. You can play as characters from franchises spanning gaming, movies, and anime.

In addition to its knack for collaborating with other brands, developer and publisher Epic Games is known for its experimentation with Fortnite (the third-person shooter recently added a tactical first-person mode). Whether you’re an avid fan who’s deep into the latest season, or prefer to stick with Fortnite’s OG mode, we’ve found 30 gifts you can buy for your favorite Fortnite fan.

Polygon’s top picks

  • Best Fortnite books
  • Best Fortnite toys and guns
  • Best Fortnite accessories
  • Best Fortnite decor
  • Best Fortnite game accessories

Best Fortnite books

$16

Having trouble placing in the top 10? The official survival guide for Fortnite gives you the best tips and tricks, right from the game’s makers. (If that’s not enough, check out our beginner’s guide.)

$11

An officially licensed drawing book that teaches you how to draw Fortnite’s most iconic items and characters, including the Loot Llama, Battle Bus, and Cuddle Team Leader.

$7

Fortnite is a game that draws from a vast palette of vivid pastel colors. This unofficial coloring book contains over 60 pages of characters, gear, and locations for you to bring to life.

$17

Characters from Fortnite team up with some of your favorite Marvel superheroes like Wolverine, Spider-Man, and more. This hardcover compilation includes all five issues of Fortnite x Marvel: Zero War, and Fortnite x Marvel - Nexus War: Thor.

Best Fortnite toys and guns

$23

Drop into this special edition of Monopoly, complete with game-specific pieces, cards, and more.

$40

This motorized assault rifle features a 10-dart clip and comes with a bonus code to unlock a similar in-game skin.

$40

The Nerf Fortnite Storm Scout is a camper’s best friend with its six-dart clip and detachable scope.

$20

This twin-pack of Nerf blasters includes a single-shot Peely blaster, and the SR Ripe hand cannon with a four-dart capacity and an optional scope.

$40

Fortnite’s unofficial mascot and loot box is now available as a 691-piece Lego model. This domesticated pack animal features a hollow interior that can be filled with Lego versions of gear from the game.

$80

This 10-pack of four-inch poseable figurines features an array of Fortnite characters, including Agent Peely, Mancake, Doctor Sloane, and more.

Best Fortnite accessories

$27

This Fortnite-themed backpack comes in various colors and patterns to match your style.

$27

This baseball cap comes in multiple patterns, including one with Fortnite’s signature typeface across the brim.

$10

The official Fortnite Loot Pack comes with pins, patches, vinyl stickers, and magnets to decorate any surface from fridges to backpacks.

$18

A polyester wallet with Fortnite graphic art printed on it. Includes zipper closure and coin pocket.

$49

This plush neon-tinted oversized hoodie is the perfect way to stay toasty in your favorite camping spot.

Best Fortnite decor

$15

Simple, Fortnite-themed posters based on the game’s most popular skins.

$6

Fortnite birthday cards to give to your friends and family, or perhaps to a battle royale fan in your life.

$23

A golden Christmas ornament based on Loot llama. It’s plastic, so it’s not heavy or difficult to clean.

$85

Fortnite doesn’t leave you, even in your dreams. A full twin bed set, including one reversible comforter, one fitted sheet, one flat sheet, one pillowcase, and one pillow sham.

$35

An acrylic bedside lamp featuring a spray paint styled logo of Fortnite’s de-facto mascot that can be powered via micro USB or by using three AAA batteries.

$20

This Fortnite Boogie Bomb lights up the room like a disco ball and plays music. Perfect for any child or adult who wants a unique party gadget.

$15

A 40 by 50-inch throw blanket with Loot Llama printed across its colorful, plush surface.

Best Fortnite game accessories

$136

The latest version of Razer’s wireless Deathadder gaming mouse is equipped with a 30K DPI optical sensor and a lightweight design. This Fortnite-branded version also includes a code for the Cliffhanger pickaxe in-game item.

$72

The Fortnite-branded version of the wired Razer Kraken V3 X features a retractable boom mic, 7.1 spatial audio, and replaces the RGB Razer logo on the side with a llama. You’ll also get a code for the Raptor Glider to use in-game.

$92

Give your desk the Fortnite treatment with this Battle Bus-inspired mouse mat. This 36-inch long mat from Razer features customizable RGB lighting around the edges and comes with a code for the Dauntless Dragon Glider in-game item.

$60

Play Fortnite Festival without a massive guitar controller. This seemingly conventional controller has five side-mounted fret buttons to emulate the inputs necessary to rock out without the need for a plastic instrument.

$8

Starting from $8.99 for 1000 V-Bucks, this precious premium currency makes for an ideal stocking filler for any Fortnite fan. V-Bucks can also be redeemed regardless of what platform you’re playing on.

$130

Play Fortnite Festival the way the good lord intended, with a replica guitar controller. The Riffmaster features a layout that will be familiar to Rock Band veterans, including solo buttons and a whammy bar.

Shopkeeper

Polygon’s handpicked deals on games, movies, books, and more.
